m_szDocSumamry: Another Blueprint for 100 Percent Renewables by Mid-Century March 13, 2014 by Herman Trabish 77 Comments The clean energy sector is awash in scenarios that suggest that 100 percent of our energy needs can be met with renewables. While the realities of implementation are far more difficult than the reports suggest, these models can serve as a helpful exercise in imagining what is possible. Stanford professor Mark Jacobson has recently released some new calculations.
